title: [K-12] Group Size and Instructional Strategies for Kindergarten Learning Environment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Child development theories for infants and toddlers, basic teaching-learning methodologies
context.additional_context: Conducting analysis and design projects for kindergarten learning environments within the context of science education.

learning_goals: Development of three or more kindergarten group activity designs applying intentional/unintentional learning approaches

Applying Bronfenbrenner’s ecological systems theory (microsystem, mesosystem, exosystem, macrosystem, chronosystem), learners analyze their learning environments (home, school, community) and write a 3-page report specifying three systemic levels (micro-meso-exo).

Using the 4D Education Quality Evaluation Framework (safety, welfare, interaction, learning environment), learners design a kindergarten classroom observation record sheet with ≥3 specific items per core element and achieve an average score of ≥4/5 via peer evaluation.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
